reviewText: This is an incredibly low budget time travel FPS game. If you're looking for polished setpieces, you won't find them here. But if you're looking for using cluster bombs on civil war battlefields to mess with history, this is your game. One mission (sorry for the mild spoiler here, but it'll help sell you on the game) involves you getting put in a POW camp, being broken out by a mysterious stranger... and then traveling back in time and being the mysterious strange who breaks yourself out of the POW camp. It's so absurd, but it's awesome. The part where future soldiers with automatic weapons show up at the eruption of Mt. Vesuvius is totally campy. The one rule of the game is that you can't mess with history... until the game tells you to mess with history.\n\nIf you're in the mood for something that's very clunky with a lot of heart, I think you'll enjoy making your way through the game. It's a pity that surface-level complaints about the game caused reviews to miss how enjoyable it is.

reviewText:
8/10
I recommend this game highly. It is a great game for those interested in an FPS that goes to different points in history.
Well, if you have an older Nvidia graphics card anyway. Running a GTX 970 the Physx features of this game wouldnt work, even with legacy drivers installed (fog, leaves, weapon smoke and other particles) - without these the game just isnt as good IMO. Therefore, i had to play on an old 9600GT to get PhysX working. Worse; It wouldnt run on my Radeon card at all.
EDIT: Tested on Windows 10 Tech Preview 64bit. Its not the OS that's causing the issue for some people. You just need an older GPU

Technical problems aside, the actual game:
PROS:
- Fantastic idea - Travelling back to various periods including WW1 and the Civil war. These arent exactly common in other games and it was a refreshing change, and on the whole they did it well. They actually explain the time tavel part of it too, and the plot involves 2 opposing groups fighting to either preserve or change history.
- Good levels - who doesnt want to form up in rank against the confederates at Antietam, or break out of a WW2 concentration camp?
- Reload animation minigame - get it right and it speeds up the reload, get it wrong and it jams and takes longer. Great mechanic.
- Weapon upgrade system
- Fairly good voice acting, and chatter from other sodiers on the battlefield
- Slight choice to pick the mission you want to do next
- Feeling like a badass when you are wrecking Romans and Confederates with future weaponry

CONS:
- Maps arent as open as they appear, invisible walls and linear design
- occassionally getting stuck to surfaces
- A few turret sections that are only ok
- you can bypass the necessity for reloading by switching to secondary and using it, by the time you go back to your primary weapon it has reloaded itself. This takes away from the feel of the game, especially in the civil war with muskets that should take a while to reload.
- The ending leaves the game open a bit for a sequel thats likely never coming.

In conclusion though, the negatives don't outweigh the positives for me and I think if you have an older nvidia card this game is definitely worth a shot. If you can get it working with PhysX the graphics hold up surprisingly well, and the game has a great concept and its a hell of a lot of fun.

reviewText:
*UPDATE*
I finally managed to launch the game with my new gaming laptop since it has NVidia graphic card. The game is surprisingly made really well and I love it! So I decided to remove completely my old review and write a brand new one, a simple pros and cons.
Pros:
+ Completely unique and cool storyline. I don't think any other game has ever thought about stories like this. This kind of story has been my dream for a pretty long time and I never thought someone actually made a game like this
+ Chosen war era is very unique. Other game developers rarely make any games about World War I, Civil War, and the American Indian war, since I know most people will hate sitting on trenches waiting for a head to pop up or having to reload for a long time after every shot while their enemies can hide in trees with bows. But I love it because it is different.
+ Great storyline, not epic but it is really cool and people would be able to make a movie out of this game.
+ Mediocre, but still acceptable graphics. Not much to expect from an old low-budget game. But it is still acceptable for me and I think it is pretty good.
+ Challenging gameplay. Just don't play on the easiest difficulty. With increased difficulty you will receive more damage and it will feel much more tense. Imagine having to reload your musket with the enemy charging you with bayonets.
+ You can use modern assault rifle in civil war era. That's fun LOL.
Cons:
- Cannot run on computers with AMD graphic cards
- Laser weapons, all weapons has 100% accuracy when you aim down the sight and 100% damage on all range. But it has no multiplayer so I don't care about OP weapons
- Abandoned by developers
- Invisible walls
- Bad voice acting
- Character dialogues tend to overlap
- Random crashes, but not too often
- Terrible soundtrack. Almost no soundtracks in-game
- No stealth element. Enemies will easily see you from far away and you get no silenced weapons. You will also move way too slow when you crouch.

Overall, you will easily notice this game is pretty crude since I heard it is a low budget game. Square-ish no expression face, bad voice acting, bad animation, no melee animation, etc. But the storyline is very unique and the war era is really not like other FPS games. There may be other FPS Civil War/American-Indian War/World War 1 game out there like Verdun, but as far as I know, people rarely make games in this war era and it makes this game worth buying and playing. The campaign itself isn't too long and it's just like finishing CoD and Battlefield's single player campaign. But I really like this game for its unique storyline and war era. However, I decided not to change my recommendation status since I personally think this game is overpriced. Wait for a discount or something. It's not worth the price for its short campaign and little to nothing replay value.

reviewText: This is actually OK, despite the really short campaign and the clunky animations. It runs well on my ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• computer, and that surprised me. So, like I said, the campaign was short. Yes, it is only between 6-8 hours, but it's one of those campaigns where you keep playing it until you can beat the entire game on the hardest difficulty with no trouble at all. It's indeed good, but animations are clunky, the story was a bit generic, and there was SO much potential thrown out the window, and there is no multiplayer. So, overall, this game is a 6/10 in my book, meaning it's good to play for a while, but you will eventually stop playing it. It wasn't worth the 20 bucks I payed for it, but more like 10 bucks.

reviewText: Oh boy, Darkest of Days. You sure were quite the attention nabber at the presentations in the eyes of many only to fall flat on your ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• on release. Darkest of Days got nothing but poor ratings across the board and, in my honest opinion, I have to disagree. Sure, the story and abrupt ending was incredibly idiotic, but the game itself isn't really all too bad. The campaign was of decent length and I had fun mowing down people in the Civil War era with a full automatic SMG. While DoD only stays in the WWI and Civil War times, it still has pretty cool mission design in some places. And I guarentee you will love the last level of the game but hate it because you wish there was more levels like it. However, I recommend Darkest of Days.

reviewText:
Once again, it's a cool game concept. Travelling through time, the possibility of playing through different eras of history and even pre-history, while occasionally bringing in weapons from a different time period to help you out, all within a first-person shooter seems like it would be hard to screw up.

HOWEVER. This game doesn't capitalize enough on its own ideas. For example, in total there are only four points in history you visit: The American Civil War, both World Wars, and Pompeii at the end. Why can't we go visit the Roman Empire? Or see the Peloponnesian Wars? Hell, why not go investigate Ancient Egypt? Or if you really want to go nuts, take the player back to pre-historic times, like the Jurassic era. Running away from a T-Rex because you're armed with nothing but a tree branch and some rocks could make for an interesting chase sequence!

On top of that, I noticed that a lot of the time, NPCs kept walking straight through walls, sometimes even getting stuck in them. Another time, an enemy was actually shooting me through a ROCK.

And if THAT weren't enough, the game ends on a friggin' cliffhanger that is highly unlikely to ever be resolved, because I doubt the developers (if they're even still around) are going to release a sequel.

Overall, it's a mediocre title that could have been fantastic, had they simply gave it a bit more effort and imagination.

reviewText:
Before I begin, there are mild spoilers about the various settings you visit in this game, if that bothers you don't read this review.

What can I say about Darkest of Days? It has been quite some time since I've last played this title and sadly, I may never get a chance to play it again (more on why exactly later). My regret at not being able to play again and my recommendation should be enough to indicate that I enjoyed this, but let me tell you why.

Darkest of Days is not a AAA title, it lacks polish and was clearly not developed with a large budget. It reminds me of a girl that you find enchanting and even sexy despite a plain apperance, because she has that certain something" you like in the opposite sex
date: she has quirks in all the right ways
recommended: that allow you to overlook or even like any flaws she has. Darkest of Days was that sort of game for me. It has bugs
hoursPlayed: it's actually kind of ugly (even when it came out)
voteText: the premise of the story is amazing
helpfulPercent: but the execution isn't very good. The main character is a faceless man rescued from certain death from the scene of Custer's last stand
votesHelpful: whisked away time agents and put under the wing of the forgettable and strange Dexter. You are then thrown in various historical periods to prevent changes to the timeline
votesTotal: it follows a somewhat predictable but not entirely boring temporal civil war-like paradigm.\n\nSo far it sounds like I hate this game
commentsCount: as I've said I like it. Why? I'm a history buff. The sheer gratitious pleasure of wielding a futuristic automatic weapon against American Civil War era soldiers
column17: and World War 1 era German soldiers was enough to sell me on the game alone. While the environments and situations are not as varied as you would think based on what I just said
column18: it was enough to keep me interested and wanting to see what happens next. This novelty of concept alone was enough to make me like this game
column19: if someone ever picks up this concept and does it better I may never want to play another first person shooter again. Also everything felt well done enough to not distract significantly from my enjoyment of the theme. By far the best segments of the game are the beginning sequences in the American Civil War and the end which takes place in the ancient world.\n\nShould you buy this? Well
column20: that depends. Remember how I mentioned I can't play this anymore? Well
column21: when I built my new PC I decided to go with an AMD GPU
column22: Darkest of Days does not function without an NVIDIA GPU and to my knowledge (and last I checked) there is no work around for this and the development house that created this game no longer exists so a solution is unlikely ever to be forthcoming. The other factor you have to consider is: does anything I mentioned to you sound like it would be as interesting to you as it was to me? Remember
column23: this isn't your Call of Duty or Battlefield. It's a somewhat mediocre offering from a small studio that collapsed. What it does have is an interesting concept
column24: it has little else going for it. If you like the concept and you can actually run it
column25: I suggest this highly as a short diversion. If not

reviewText:
My take on the Game

+ explores two eras that have been left behind in the gaming industry (US civil war and World War One)
+ gun upgrade system related to ingame performance (and guns change visually to some upgrades)
+ good maps (very open; much happens in multiple areas and sidepaths which allows for some replayability, ...)
+ NPC's use languages according to nationality (German NPC soldiers in ww1 speak german most of the time, ...)
+ graphics were good for their time

- story leaves you with quite a cliffhanger yet no sequel can be expected
- characters are sometimes dull
- NPC's, like in many other games, spam 'battle cries'
- even though NPC's use the language according to their nationality the translations and voices themselves are frankly poorly made (german NPC soldiers in ww1 sometimes speak like some english dude tried to speak german or something that isn't even german, ...)
- AI is sometimes not all that intelligent
- logical errors (you change history yet people from the future somehow still remember how history was supposed to go down, ...)
- only story- and some kind of skirmish-mode

---------------------------------------------

In Deutsch:



Was ich vom Game halte:

+ Erkundet zwei √Ñren welche von der Spieleindustrie vernachl√§ssigt werden (den US B√ºrgerkrieg und den Ersten Weltkrieg)
+ Waffenupgradesystem verbunden mit der Performance des Spielers (ebenfalls ver√§ndern sich die Waffen nach einigen Upgrades visuell)
+ Gute Karten (sehr offen, vieles passiert in mehreren Arealen und Alternativrouten was etwas Wiederspielwert gibt, ...)
+ NPC's benutzen die Sprache ihres Landes (Deutsche NPC im Ersten Weltkrieg reden meistens Deutsch, ...)
+ Graphik war gut f√ºr ihre Zeit

- Die Geschichte l√§sst einen mit einem Cliffhanger zur√ºck und es kann kein zweiter Teil erwartet werden
- Charaktere sind manchmal langweilig
- NPC's spammen Schlachtrufe wieder und wieder
- Auch wenn die NPC Wahrheitsgetreue Sprachen sprechen sind die √úbersetzungen und Stimmen selber manchmal einfach nur schlecht (Deutsche Soldaten im Ersten Weltkrieg sprechen manchmal so, als ob ein Engl√§nder Deutsch zu sprechen versuchte oder sogar etwas, das nicht einmal Deutsch ist, ...)
- Die AI ist manchmal nicht ganz helle
- Logische Fehler (Man ver√§ndert die Geschichte aber die Leute aus der Zukunft scheinen die Geschichte noch immer so zu kennen wie sie eigentlich ablief, ...)
- nur Story- und Pl√§nkelei-Modus

reviewText:
Been wanting to play this game since it came out. Glad I did. :D

+Pretty interesting story.
+Great level design.
+A fair amount of weapons, some of which are really awesome.
+Good progressive challenge level. Halfway through the game I had to crank it down from medium to easy.
+Graphics are good for their age.
+Can fight endless swarms of Nazis.
+Can replay any mission later with any selection of weapons you've unlocked.

-Really short, but this could have been to keep the game from dragging on.
-Oldschool shooter mechanics. No leaning or prone, for example.
-No multiplayer

All in all, pretty good! I recommend it, especially on sale. You're only paying for 8 hours of gameplay, and that's if you die a lot like I did, so keep that in mind.

Only thing that would have made the game better is if it had TimeShift's time manipulation gameplay features. But regardless, great job, devs. :) This game is just as awesome as I'd hoped it would be.

8/10

reviewText:
This game may be buggy but its hell of a alot of fun to blast through.

The concept alone is enough to keep you playing just to see how crazy the game gets.

If you like history and single player only first person shooter story driven games I definately recommend this. The only thing this game is missing is high quality production values.

The A.I. appear in vast numbers but are really dumb, characters look like clones and glitch through scenery whilst the games campaign lasts around 8 hours.

In short its a budget game made special by its original concept.

If any shooter deserves a high quality well made sequel or spiritual successor its Darkest of Days.... We can only hope.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Darkest of days is a game worthy for history fans. There's one problem: it's too short. The game has a huge potential, but it has bugs and often crash especially graphics as well. The plot is trying to be cool, but feels like a Sci-Fi B movie at best. The ending was like weak to say. I must address the pro and cons of the game.

Pro: the actual historical weapons are accurate. Imagine reloading a rifle musket is long and tedious. If you planned to use it in close range, use its range since its rifling barrel gives huge advantage. I recommend use the rifle musket in long range. WWI weapons are authentic to say which its very impressive that the developers understood the weapons of the time. What's great to experience some of historical moments in Civil War to WWI, but I will not spoil it.

Con: the story felt weak, graphical issues, and wasted potential. They could done a better job explaining, but they assume time travel as if it was Back to the Future. I would like to see Time Travel fit with Multiverse theory where altered timeline interact with original time. This is like as if it was a Terminator's version done badly. The graphics are another problem; if you don't have Nvida, don't buy this game. But if you have Nvida even a good one, it will crash for no good reason. My laptop can run Attila total war without any problems, but this game will continuous crash. The AI is the worse and sometime use an aiming bot as if out of nowhere.

The AI are like brain dead and always focus on you instead of other enemies. The game is flawed in the content and the ending is a sequel bait which they were about to make a franchise out of it.

Conclusion: I do enjoy the game. Not perfect, but I would play it once and awhile. This game is a guilty pleasure and might do a Let's Play series. My rating on this game based on enjoyment, criticism, and idea is 5/10. It has flaws which many will not enjoy, graphical issues, weak spiked difficulty AI, and weak story. However, I like this potential idea where I wish some one will remake this game or a better than first one sequel, historical events, and using historical firearms.

reviewText: Please make a sequel! This is the only FPS game so far I've found set in WW1. And it was so much fun! So many people think that world war 1 is just sitting in trenches and choking on gas. And yes, that was PART of the war, not all of it. Although this game is not directly a WW1 game, it was what made be buy it. The time travel stuff is pretty interesting and the overall story is good. Though, some parts of the story I think was pretty lame. But overall, you should buy this game if you like history and a good ol' shoot everything you see.

reviewText: AMD WARNING\nthis game is amazing. int is my favorite game ever infeact. has so many twists and turns and you never know what will happen next. the story is far better than many AAA tittles today. But... sadly if u have an AMD graphics card like me you can not play this game. the card dose not suppor the physX and the game dose not alow you to turn it off. this just causes the game to run with a back screen. it realy pains me to see this happen to a game like this but they wont fix it anytime soon, if ever, so i can never play this truly wonderful work of art ever again.\n
